_header: The first day of the moon Adam / Our fore father to the…
Note: The Old French version occurs in London, British Library Royal 12 C.XII, Art. 25; and Worcester, Cathedral Lib. Q.61, f. 42v, printed by bad key, 21. For versions which prefix a short Prologue see 1593 and 3247; for prose versions see Lewis, Blake, and Edwards (1985) XR. E. Lewis, N. F. Blake, and A. S. G. Edwards. Index of Printed Middle English Prose. New York: Garland, 1985, 100, 337.
_description: Lunationes et Somnia or Somnia Danieli — 1282 lines.

BLHar3725.First Lines: The first day of the mone AdamOwre fore fader to the world came…
BLHar3725.Last Lines: …That dat is tyme godeIeff þu will blede wayne blode

BLRoy12Exvi.First Lines:
The furste of the moone adam our former fadyr to þis worlde
                    cameThat day ys good without synne all thyng to begyne…
BLRoy12Exvi.Last Lines:
…To by & fyl & make weddyng to passe þe se & lete
                    bloode& to al oþer thyngis goode That þu wult by gyn
                    than
BLRoy12Exvi.Note:
Two verse lines per manuscript line.
                    Incomplete.
